title: Aleksandar Vujić
text: This will be my personal website. I am sick of not being able to find a job. Not decent job, any job! I am about to finish my PhD in psychology - problematic smartphone use, that is. I do stats in R, sometimes in SPSS and JASP. I am learning Python and Web development, not extremely succesfully. I like SF, Religion talks, and stupid jokes. I used to enjoy music, but not so much anymore.

Cyberchondria and Questionable Health Practices: The Mediation Role of Conspiracy Mentality


Vujić, A., Dinić, B. M., & Jokić-begić, N.


The first objective of this study was to test the factor structure, reliability, and convergent validity of Serbian adaptations of the Cyberchondria Severity Scale (CSS-12) and the Short Cyberchondria Scale (SCS). The second aim was to test the…


cyberchondria, complementary/alternative medicine, pseudoscientific practices, conspiracy mentality


Apr 3, 2023




Hedonic use, stress, and life satisfaction as predictors of smartphone addiction


Vujić, A., & Szabo, A.


Based on the compensatory internet use theory, hedonic or non-utilitarian smartphone use might be associated with SA. The study concludes that being female, hedonic smartphone use, and perceived life stress predict SA. 


Behavioral addiction, Cyberchondria, Intolerance of uncertainty, Problematic smartphone Use, Smartphone addiction


May 3, 2023




Are Cyberchondria and Intolerance of Uncertainty Related to Smartphone Addiction?


Vujić, A., Volarov, M., Latas, M., Demetrovics, Z., Kiraly, O., & Szabo, A. 


Based on the compensatory internet use theory, hedonic or non-utilitarian smartphone use might be associated with SA. The study concludes that being female, hedonic smartphone use, and perceived life stress predict SA.

Properties of the Serbian Smartphone Application-Based Addiction Scale (SABAS) and Validation of the English Version Among Non-native English Speakers.


Vujić, A., Volarov, M., Latas, M., Griffiths, M. D., & Szabo, A.


Based on the study’s findings, the Serbian version of SABAS is a reliable and valid measure for screening the risk of smartphone addiction. Moreover, the English version can be used among non-native Serbian English speakers. 


Behavioural addiction, Mobile phone, Psychometric, Smartphone addiction, Validation, SABAS

title: Professional Summary
text: Responsible and reliable psychologist and researcher, highly motivated to gather knowledge and assimilate new concepts in teaching, customer support, HR, statistics, data science, analytics as well as in communications. Ready to contribute to the collective progress and the well-being of its members.

title: Professional Summary

title: Third Blog Post
text:
The source for any page in your website could also be a Jupyter Notebook. This one is third-post/index.ipynb.
Here’s an example I borrowed from the Seaborn docs:

import seaborn as sns

sns.set_theme(style="whitegrid")

# Load the diamonds dataset
diamonds = sns.load_dataset("diamonds")

# Plot the distribution of clarity ratings, conditional on carat
sns.displot(
    data=diamonds,
    x="carat", hue="cut",
    kind="kde", height=4, aspect=1.5,
    multiple="fill", clip=(0, None),
    palette="ch:rot=-.25,hue=1,light=.75",   
)
